pageContext.claim: “Meanwhile, Biden, he doesn't say a word about the thousands of African-Americans who are murdered each year as a result of violent crime in Democrat-controlled cities, they're murdered by the thousands and they'd never ever mention it.”
pageContext.analysis: Biden spoke extensively about crime in the Black community throughout his presidential bid. That is in part because his support for the 1994 crime bill that —among other things— pushed for mandatory minimums for non-violent drug users led to concern about Biden’s ability to connect to Black voters, which Democrats need in order to win the presidency.
